Description: Body sherd Chian, possibly Simple Animal Style pottery chalice or Type B1 kantharos; white slip; interior: glazed black; part of lotus bud in added whte outline with added red centre followed by two concentric white bands; exterior: reserved.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Musée du Louvre. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

Chalice Style chalices (including patterned chalices) have little decoration on their interior and exterior. Given the size of the sherd, it may come from an undecorated part of the chalice. Kantharoi Type B (See Williams, D. ‘Aigina, Aphaia-Tempel 5. The pottery from Chios’, Archäologischer Anzeiger 1983, 169) also have very little decoration. Kantharoi Type B1 have lotus flowers and lotus buds on the interior above two concentric white bands (Williams 1983, 169) and many kantharoi Type B have painted inscriptions beneath the rim; several have been found on Aegina as well as at Naukratis.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1513) (phase 2)
